entry.title: The Ashton, Leigh and Wigan Community Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Amendment Order 2011
The Investment Bank Special Administration (England and Wales) Rules 2011
entry.summary: These Rules set out the procedure for the Investment Bank Special Administration process under the Investment Bank Special Administration Regulations 2011 (“the Regulations”).

entry.title: The Pensions Act 2007 (Commencement No. 4) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order brings into force section 15(1) of the Pensions Act 2007 on 6th April 2012, defined as the “abolition date” by section 15(2) of that Act. Section 15(1) abolishes contracting-out of the state additional pension for defined contribution pension schemes. Part 1 of Schedule 4 to that Act will also have effect from 6th April 2012 by virtue of section 15(4). The Order also brings into force certain consequential amendments contained within Part 2 of Schedule 4 to that Act, and certain repeals contained within Part 7 of Schedule 7 to that Act, on 6th April 2012 and 6th April 2015.

entry.title: The Pensions Act 2007 (Abolition of Contracting-out for Defined Contribution Pension Schemes) (Consequential Amendments) Regulations 2011

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Pensions Act 2007 (Abolition of Contracting-out for Defined Contribution Pension Schemes) (Consequential Amendments) (No. 2) Regulations 2011

entry.summary: These Regulations are made under section 15 of the Pensions Act 2007 (c.22), which abolishes contracting-out of the state additional pension for pension schemes on a defined contributions basis. It provides that contracting-out certificates in relation to money purchase contracted-out schemes and appropriate schemes (as defined by section 181(1) of the Pension Schemes Act 1993) cease to have effect from the abolition date.

entry.title: The Courts Act 2003 (Continuing Provision of Court-houses) (Amendment) Regulations 2011
The Pensions Act 2008 (Commencement No. 10) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order brings into force section 106 of the Pensions Act 2008 (c.30), and related repeals, which provide for the removal of special provisions which apply to the protected rights of members of pension schemes on the contracting-out abolition date (defined in section 106(4) of that Act as the day appointed under section 30 of the Pensions Act 2007 (c.22) for the coming into force of section 15(1) of the Pensions Act 2007). The Pensions Act 2007 (Commencement No. 4) Order 2011 [S.I. 2011/1267 (C. 51)] specifies 6th April 2012 as the day for the coming into force of section 15(1) of the Pensions Act 2007.

entry.title: The Pensions Act 2008 (Abolition of Protected Rights) (Consequential Amendments) Order 2011

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Pensions Act 2008 (Abolition of Protected Rights) (Consequential Amendments) (No.2) Order 2011

entry.summary: This Order is made under section 145 of the Pensions Act 2008 (c.30), which provides for amendments to be made in consequence of section 106 of that Act. Section 106 abolishes the protected rights of members of pension schemes contracted-out on a defined contributions basis, from the contracted-out abolition date (the date for the coming into force of section 15(1) of the Pensions Act 2007 (c.22)).

entry.title: The Whole of Government Accounts (Designation of Bodies) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order designates the bodies listed in the Schedule in relation to the financial year ending on 31st March 2011 for the purposes of the Government Resources and Accounts Act 2000. The effect of designation is that these bodies are required to prepare and present to the Treasury such financial information in relation to that financial year as the Treasury require to enable them to prepare Whole of Government Accounts.

entry.title: The Immigration (Designation of Travel Bans) (Amendment No.4) Order 2011
The Companies Act 2006 (Consequential Amendments and Transitional Provisions) Order 2011

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Companies Act 2006 (Consequential Amendments and Transitional Provisions) Order 2011

entry.summary: This Order makes amendments to primary and secondary legislation which are consequential on certain provisions of the Companies Act 2006 (c.46) having been brought into force, including the replacement of references to various provisions of the Companies Act 1985 (c.6) with references to the appropriate, superseding provisions of the Companies Act 2006 and the removal of references to the repealed Companies (Northern Ireland) Order 1986 (S.I. 1986/1032 (N.I.6)).

entry.title: The Public Health (Aircraft and Ships) (Isle of Man) (Amendment) Order 2011
The Transfer of Functions (Museum and Other Staff) Order 2011
entry.summary: This Order in Council is made under section 1 of the Ministers of the Crown Act 1975. It transfers certain statutory functions relating to the consent to appointment, and to the terms, conditions, remuneration and allowances, of staff of the Imperial War Museum, the British Museum, the Natural History Museum and the Registrar of Public Lending Right from the Treasury to the Secretary of State for Culture, Olympics, Media and Sport.

entry.title: The General Medical Council (Applications for General Practice and Specialist Registration) (Amendment) Regulations Order of Council 2011
entry.summary: This Order approves the General Medical Council (Applications for General Practice and Specialist Registration) (Amendment) Regulations 2011. Those Regulations amend the General Medical Council (Applications for General Practice and Specialist Registration) Regulations 2010 (scheduled to SI 2010/475) (“the principal Regulations”). The principal Regulations provide for the procedure to be followed by or in relation to a person applying to the Registrar of the General Medical Council (“the GMC”) for inclusion in the GMC’s General Practitioner Register or the Specialist Register and include provision as to the evidence required in support of such applications and for notification of decisions in respect of them.

entry.title: The Syria (Asset-Freezing) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to the enforcement of Council Regulation (EU) No. 442/2011 of 9 May 2011 (OJ L 121, 10.5.2011, p.1) (“the Council Regulation”) concerning restrictive measures in view of the situation in Syria.

entry.title: The Tobacco Advertising and Promotion (Display and Specialist Tobacconists) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Tobacco Advertising and Promotion (Display) (England) Regulations 2010 (the “Display Regulations”) and the Tobacco Advertising and Promotion (Specialist Tobacconists) (England) Regulations 2010 (the “Specialist Tobacconist Regulations”).

entry.title: The Crime and Disorder (Formulation and Implementation of Strategy) (Amendment) Regulations 2011
entry.summary: These Regulations provide in regulations 3 and 4 for the substitution of regulations 3 and 8, respectively, in the Crime and Disorder (Formulation and Implementation of Strategy) Regulations 2007 (the “2007 Regulations”) with effect from 1stJune 2011. Regulation 3 of the 2007 Regulations relates to the composition and meeting of a strategy group for each local government area, whose function is to prepare strategic assessments in accordance with regulations 5 to 7 and to prepare and implement a partnership plan in accordance with regulations 10 and 11. Regulation8 of the 2007 Regulations relates to the composition and meeting of a county strategy group which prepares a community safety agreement in accordance with regulation 9.

entry.title: The Health Act 2009 (Commencement No.3) (Amendment) Order 2011
The Immigration (European Economic Area) (Amendment) Regulations 2011
The Constitutional Reform Act 2005 (Consequential Amendments) Order 2011

ukm:Subject.Value: SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED KINGDOM

category.term: SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED KINGDOM

entry.summary: This Order makes consequential amendments to subordinate legislation which provided for appeals to the House of Lords, replacing references to the House of Lords with references to the Supreme Court. The Constitutional Reform Act 2005 abolished the appellate jurisdiction of the House of Lords and created the Supreme Court of the United Kingdom. The Order is made under section 143 of the Constitutional Reform Act 2005 (c.4).

entry.title: The Pensions Appeal Tribunals Act 1943 (Armed Forces and Reserve Forces Compensation Scheme) (Rights of Appeal) Regulations 2011

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Pensions Appeal Tribunals Act 1943 (Armed Forces and Reserve Forces Compensation Scheme) (Rights of Appeal) Regulations 2011
